alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 1:05AM CST until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall and runoff is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Harris. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 103 AM CST, Rainfall rates have tapered off, however any standing water on streets will take a while to recede. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bellaire, West University Place, Jacinto City, Midtown Houston, Fourth Ward, Downtown Houston, Neartown / Montrose, Greater Third Ward, Macgregor, Greater Eastwood, University Place, Second Ward, Near Northside Houston, Memorial Park, Greater Fifth Ward, Greater Heights, Afton Oaks / River Oaks Area, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, Astrodome Area and southeastern Northside / Northline. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
